item.text: Then Aaron’s sons, Nadab and Abihu, each took his fire pan and put fire in it, set incense on it, and presented strange fire before the Lord, which he had not commanded them to do.
So fire went out from the presence of the Lord and consumed them so that they died before the Lord.
Moses then said to Aaron, “This is what the Lord spoke: ‘Among the ones close to me I will show myself holy, and in the presence of all the people I will be honored.’” So Aaron kept silent.

<st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> then <st data-num="07121" class="">called</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04332" class="">Mishael</st> and <st data-num="0469" class="">Elzaphan</st>, the <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="05816" class="">Uzziel</st>, <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron’s</st> <st data-num="01730" class="">uncle</st>, and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> them, “<st data-num="07126" class="">Come near</st>, <st data-num="05375" class="">carry</st> your <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="06440" class="">front</st> of the <st data-num="06944" class="">sanctuary</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> a <st data-num="02351" class="">place outside</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st>.”

So they <st data-num="07126" class="">came near</st> and <st data-num="05375" class="">carried</st> them <st data-num="05375" class="">away</st> in their <st data-num="03801" class="">tunics</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> a <st data-num="02351" class="">place outside</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st> just <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> had <st data-num="01696" class="">spoken</st>.

Then Moses said to Aaron and to Eleazar and Ithamar his other two sons, “Do not dishevel the hair of your heads and do not tear your garments, so that you do not die and so that wrath does not come on the whole congregation. Your brothers, all the house of Israel, are to mourn the burning that the Lord has caused,
but you must not go out from the entrance of the Meeting Tent lest you die, for the Lord’s anointing oil is on you.” So they acted according to the word of Moses.
Then the Lord spoke to Aaron,

“Do <st data-num="0408" class="">not</st> <st data-num="08354" class="">drink</st> <st data-num="03196" class="">wine</st> or <st data-num="07941" class="">strong drink</st>, <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> and your <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> you, when you <st data-num="0935" class="">enter</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="04150" class="">Meeting</st> <st data-num="0168" class="">Tent</st>, so that you do <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">die</st>. This is a <st data-num="05769" class="">perpetual</st> <st data-num="02708" class="">statute</st> throughout your <st data-num="01755" class="">generations</st>,<n id="1" />

as well as<n id="1" /> to <st data-num="0914" class="">distinguish</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> the <st data-num="06944" class="">holy</st> and the <st data-num="02455" class="">common</st>, and <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> the <st data-num="02931" class="">unclean</st> and the <st data-num="02889" class="">clean</st>,<n id="2" />
and to teach the Israelites all the statutes that the Lord has spoken to them through Moses.”

Then Moses spoke to Aaron and to Eleazar and Ithamar, his remaining sons, “Take the grain offering which remains from the gifts of the Lord and eat it unleavened beside the altar, for it is most holy.
You must eat it in a holy place because it is your allotted portion and the allotted portion of your sons from the gifts of the Lord, for this is what I have been commanded.

Also, the <st data-num="02373" class="">breast</st> of the <st data-num="08573" class="">wave offering</st> and the <st data-num="07785" class="">thigh</st> of the <st data-num="08641" class="">contribution offering</st> you must <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> in a <st data-num="02889" class="">ceremonially clean</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st>, <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> and your <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> and <st data-num="01323" class="">daughters</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> you, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> the foods have been <st data-num="05414" class="">given</st> as your <st data-num="02706" class="">allotted portion</st> and the <st data-num="02706" class="">allotted portion</st> of your <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> from the <st data-num="08002" class="">peace-offering</st> <st data-num="02077" class="">sacrifices</st> of the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st>.<n id="2" />

The thigh of the contribution offering and the breast of the wave offering they must bring in addition to the gifts of the fat parts to wave them as a wave offering before the Lord, and it will belong to you and your sons with you for a perpetual statute just as the Lord has commanded.”
Later Moses sought diligently for the sin-offering male goat, but it had actually been burnt. So he became angry at Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s remaining sons, saying,
“Why did you not eat the sin offering in the sanctuary? For it is most holy, and he gave it to you to bear the iniquity of the congregation, to make atonement on their behalf before the Lord.

<st data-num="02005" class="">See here</st>!<n id="1" /> Its <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> was <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">brought</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="06944" class="">Holy Place</st> <st data-num="06441" class="">within</st>!<n id="2" /> You should <st data-num="0398" class="">certainly</st> have <st data-num="0398" class="">eaten</st> it in the <st data-num="06944" class="">sanctuary</st> just <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> I <st data-num="06680" class="">commanded</st>!”

But Aaron spoke to Moses, “See here! Just today they presented their sin offering and their burnt offering before the Lord, and such things as these have happened to me! If I had eaten a sin offering today, would the Lord have been pleased?”
When Moses heard this explanation, he was satisfied.
